item.title: Azure Automation: Graphical and textual runbook authoring
item.description:
Azure Automation: Graphical and textual runbook authoring

Tuesday, January 5, 2016 In Azure Automation in the new Azure portal you can author runbooks using a graphical tool and a graphical programming model, with little or no code required. Simply insert activities from the library to the canvas, link them together into a workflow, and configure the properties in order to create useful runbooks that automate your IT processes.

item.title: The Year Ahead: What's in Store for Machine Learning? - The New Stack
item.description:
The Year Ahead: What's in Store for Machine Learning? - The New Stack

It's been a breakthrough year for machine learning. This form of artificial intelligence - which uses algorithms to provide computers with the ability to learn from data and make computational predictions without explicit programming - has long been confined to academia since the 1950s. But there's a noticeable shift in the air, as we're seeing ...

item.title: Keep watch in 2016 on these Seattle startup stars
item.description:
Keep watch in 2016 on these Seattle startup stars

From a growing IT automation company to a developer of a 3-D laser printer, a number of companies are leading the Seattle area's vibrant startup scene. Amazon.com, Expedia and other local technology giants are growing with such increasing speed in the past several months that it's sometimes easy to forget that the Puget Sound region's scene of smaller companies is booming as well.

item.title: 14 things successful people do before breakfast
item.description:
14 things successful people do before breakfast

"If it has to happen, then it has to happen first," writes Laura Vanderkam, a time-management expert and the author of " What the Most Successful People Do Before Breakfast." Those among us who have managed to find professional success and eke out a life actively embrace this philosophy.

item.title: What is the MEAN Stack and Why is it Better than LAMP?
item.description:
What is the MEAN Stack and Why is it Better than LAMP?

For many years, the go-to infrastructure for Web-driven applications has been the LAMP stack. Now, there's a another stack that's widely considered as an alternative to LAMP; the MEAN stack. This article gives you an overview of both Web platforms including the advantages of the MEAN stack.

item.title: 12 Days of DevOps
item.description:
12 Days of DevOps

'Tis the season. You know the tune. On the twelfth day of DevOps, our business gave to me... 12 GitHub repos, 11 Puppetmasters, 10 deploys a day, 9 Chefs a-knifing, 8 unicorns, 7 wastes of lean, 6 devs a-pairing, 5 golden images, 4 Jenkins servers, 3 DevOps ways, 2 AMIs, And 1 team to help...

item.title: Oracle just bought a tiny, year-old cloud computing startup called StackEngine
item.description:
Oracle just bought a tiny, year-old cloud computing startup called StackEngine

Oracle just bought an Austin, Texas startup called StackEngine, according to documents Oracle filed with the SEC. StackEngine just publicly announced the purchase on its home page, too. The SEC filing doesn't say how much Oracle paid for the startup. It was founded in 2014 and had raised $4.5 million.

item.title: Powering ITV's DevOps engine with the Elastic stack
item.description:
Powering ITV's DevOps engine with the Elastic stack

Powering ITV's DevOps Engine with the Elastic stack ITV is the oldest commercial TV network in the United Kingdom. It is an integrated producer broadcaster, operating the largest commercial family of channels in the UK. In addition to traditional broadcasting on our channels, we deliver our content on demand through numerous platforms, both directly and via the ITV Hub.

item.title: Connections: DevOps initiatives shouldn't just touch the new stuff
item.description:
Connections: DevOps initiatives shouldn't just touch the new stuff

Although I feel as if it's been dispelled to a significant degree, there lingers the misperception that DevOps [1] is mostly for companies that sport ping-pong tables and have free sushi for lunch. Firms that manufacture construction equipment and have large swaths of legacy computer code? Not so much.

item.title: The Role of Configuration Management in a Containerized World
item.description:
The Role of Configuration Management in a Containerized World

Docker has seen widespread adoption as an infrastructure automation tool and there has been a growing debate as to whether it supersedes configuration management (CM) tools. With most CM tools providing support for Docker, the consensus seems to be to use both CM and containers in tandem for without ditching one in favor of the other.
